context: The Trade Desk is a leading independent demand-side platform (DSP) focused on the open internet, holding 6.77% market share in the video ad platform category. Operating in the digital advertising market expected to grow at 15.4% CAGR from 2025 to 2030, TTD faces intensifying competition from both walled gardens (Meta, Apple, Google, Amazon) that control inventory and first-party data, and other independent DSP platforms.

competitors.name: Google DV360 (Display & Video 360)
competitors.notes: Primary DSP competitor and walled garden powerhouse, deeply integrated with Google's services including YouTube and Search. Co-dominates the DSP landscape alongside The Trade Desk but operates within Google's ecosystem

competitors.name: Amazon Advertising
competitors.notes: Major walled garden competitor with strong growth, delivering $17.6 billion in Q3 2025 revenues (up 22% YoY). Leverages first-party e-commerce data for highly targeted advertising, creating growing competitive pressure especially in CTV and retail media

competitors.name: Meta Platforms
competitors.notes: Dominant walled garden competitor controlling Facebook and Instagram inventory with extensive first-party user data enabling highly targeted ad campaigns across social media properties

competitors.name: StackAdapt
competitors.notes: Top independent alternative to The Trade Desk, offering multi-channel programmatic advertising platform competing in the open internet DSP space

competitors.name: Viant Technology
competitors.notes: Cross-channel advertising software competitor and DSP platform alternative, focusing on people-based advertising and identity solutions

competitors.name: AdRoll
competitors.notes: Alternative DSP platform competing in cross-channel advertising, particularly strong in retargeting and e-commerce advertising solutions

competitors.name: LiveRamp Data Collaboration Platform
competitors.notes: Competitor in data connectivity and addressability for advertising, enabling identity resolution and data collaboration for targeted advertising campaigns

competitors.name: Mediaocean
competitors.notes: Advertising software competitor providing ad tech platform and workflow solutions, competing in campaign management and programmatic buying
